admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF032571-CROATIA - HIGHWAY SECTOR - ROAD
            SAFETY STUDY

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, though institutional development
            impacts were only modest. The main lessons address issues as
            follows. The strategy for addressing the uneconomic motorway
            program, was successful due to the patient approach taken by
            the Bank, who - not until the newly elected Parliament
            approved a more disciplined roads program - chose an
            intensified dialogue through sector work, and discussion on
            a proposed Bank guarantee for the Zagreb-Gorican Motorway.
            Nonetheless, further continuous dialogue over major sector
            issues will still be required. Given the country's
            economic transition, it is worth mentioning that the
            competitive approach of the commercialized/privatized
            construction industry, was conducive to an estimated cost
            reduction of ten percent, enhanced by current management
            practices, and technical and economic criteria, that
            improved budgetary allocations. However, the Government
            should focus on the economic evaluation, and rationalization
            of the motorway program, as well as expediting land
            expropriation which could delay works. Finally, accession to
            the European Union plays an accelerating role in
            institutional reforms, thus road user charges, traffic
            safety, and pavement standards are issues to be addressed.
